arts.ttl: Everton end Crystal Palace unbeaten run with late winner
arts.sum: Jack Grealish scored a late winner as Everton came from behind to beat Crystal Palace 2-1 in the Premier League on Sunday. Palace arrived at The Hill Dickinson Stadium on the back of a club-record unbeaten run, having gone 19 games without defeat in all competitions after victory over Dynamo Kyiv in the Europa Conference […] The post Everton end Crystal Palace unbeaten run with late winner first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Super Jack is back! Late Grealish winner for Everton ends Crystal Palace’s unbeaten run
arts.sum: Jack Grealish scores his first Everton goal in second-half stoppage time to secure a dramatic 2-1 Premier League win against Crystal Palace at the Hill Dickinson Stadium on Sunday afternoon.

arts.ttl: Grealish grabs late winner as Everton end Crystal Palace’s unbeaten run
arts.athr: Andy Hunter at Hill Dickinson Stadium
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner looked on aghast while his Crystal Palace players rubbed their heads and sank to their knees in sheer disbelief. As well they might. Palace’s 19-game unbeaten run is over, vanishing against a late and thoroughly unexpected Everton recovery capped by Jack Grealish’s first goal for David Moyes’ team. Everton have been Palace’s bogey team for several years but their first away win since 2014 beckoned after Daniel Muñoz gave the visitors a deserved interval lead. There are some miracles that Glasner can not conjure, however, and after Iliman Ndiaye hauled the hosts back into the contest from the penalty spot a fortunate 93rd minute strike from Grealish condemned Palace to their first defeat since 16 April. It was an outcome no one would have predicted for the majority of the contest. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Jack Grealish hits added-time winner as Everton end Crystal Palace unbeaten run
arts.sum: Iliman Ndiaye got the Toffees back on level terms from the penalty spot after Daniel Munoz’s first-half opener.

arts.ttl: Everton 2-1 Crystal Palace: Jack Grealish ends Palace's 19-game unbeaten run with dramatic winner
arts.sum: Jack Grealish scored in stoppage time to end Crystal Palace's 19-game unbeaten run as Everton staged an unlikely comeback to snatch a 2-1 win.

arts.ttl: Everton vs Crystal Palace LIVE: Dibling makes first Everton start against unchanged Palace
arts.sum:
Everton XI:  Pickford, O'Brien, Tarkowski, Keane, Mykolenko, Gueye, Garner, Ndiaye, Dibling, Grealish, Barry.

Palace XI: Henderson, Guehi, Richards, Lacroix, Munoz, Hughes, Lerma, Mitchell, Sarr, Pino, Mateta

arts.ttl: Everton vs. Crystal Palace confirmed XIs: Dibling, Barry, Sarr, Mitchell decisions made
arts.sum: Everton and Crystal Palace confirm their starting lineups for this afternoon’s Premier League clash at the Hill Dickinson Stadium.
